callback.name: MM/dd/YYYY hh:mm:ss

description.localized_desc: dd matches the number of the day (1, 2, 3, etc...) MM matches the name of the month (Jan, Feb, Mar, etc...) YYYY matches the year (2012) hh:mm:ss matches the time (23:54:42)

callback.code: r = re.compile('(?P<month>\d{2})/(?P<day>\d{2})/(?P<year>\d{4}) (?P<hour>\d{2}):(?P<minute>\d{2}):(?P<second>\d{2})') date = r.search(value).groupdict() date = dict([(u, int(date[u])) for u in date.keys()]) newdate = datetime(**date) log['date'] = newdate

callback.name: dd/MMM/YYYY:hh:mm:ss

description.localized_desc: dd matches the number of the day (1, 2, 3, etc...) MMM matches the name of the month (Jan, Feb, Mar, etc...) YYYY matches the year (2012) hh:mm:ss matches the time (23:54:42)

callback.code:
english_months = {'Jan': 1, 'Feb': 2, 'Mar': 3, 'Apr': 4, 'May': 5, 'Jun': 6, 'Jul': 7, 'Aug': 8, 'Sep': 9, 'Oct': 10, 'Nov': 11, 'Dec': 12} ctf = re.compile("(?P<day>\d+)/(?P<month>[a-zA-Z]+)/(?P<year>\d+):(?P<hour>\d+):(?P<minute>\d+):(?P<second>\d+)") m = ctf.search(value) if m: vals = m.groupdict() vals['month'] = english_months[vals['month']] vals = dict( [ (u, int(vals[u])) for u in vals.keys() ]) newdate = datetime(**vals)
log['date'] = newdate else: raise Exception, "invalid date string %s" % value

callback.name: MMM dd hh:mm:ss

description.localized_desc: MMM matches the name of the month (Jan, Feb, Mar, etc...) dd matches the number of the day (1, 2, 3, etc...) hh:mm:ss matches the time (23:54:42)

callback.code:
MONTHS = ['Jan', 'Feb', 'Mar', 'Apr', 'May', 'Jun', 'Jul', 'Aug', 'Sep', 'Oct', 'Nov', 'Dec'] now = datetime.now() currentyear = now.year # Following line may throw a lot of ValueError newdate = datetime(currentyear, MONTHS.index(value[0:3]) + 1, int(value[4:6]), int(value[7:9]), int(value[10:12]), int(value[13:15])) if '_timezone' in log.keys(): test_date = extras.to_naive_utc(newdate, log['_timezone']) test_value = datetime.utcnow() else: test_date = newdate test_value = datetime.now() # give it a minute of latency if test_date > test_value + timedelta(minutes=+1): newdate = newdate.replace(year = newdate.year - 1)
log['date'] = newdate

callback.name: MMM dd YYYY hh:mm:ss

description.localized_desc: MMM matches the name of the month (Jan, Feb, Mar, etc...) dd matches the number of the day (1, 2, 3, etc...) hh:mm:ss matches the time (23:54:42) YYYY matches the year (2012)

callback.code: MONTHS = ['Jan', 'Feb', 'Mar', 'Apr', 'May', 'Jun', 'Jul', 'Aug', 'Sep', 'Oct', 'Nov', 'Dec'] # Following line may throw a lot of ValueError newdate = datetime(int(value[7:11]), MONTHS.index(value[0:3]) + 1, int(value[4:6]), int(value[12:14]), int(value[15:17]), int(value[18:20])) log['date'] = newdate

callBack.name: DDD MMM dd hh:mm:ss YYYY

description.localized_desc: DDD matches the name of the day (Mon, Tue, Wed, etc...) MMM matches the name of the month (Jan, Feb, Mar, etc...) dd matches the number of the day (1, 2, 3, etc...) hh:mm:ss matches the time (23:54:42) YYYY matches the year (2012)

callBack.code:
reg = re.compile(u'(?P<month>[A-Z]{1}[a-z]{2}) (?P<day>\d{1,2}) (?P<hours>\d{2}):(?P<minutes>\d{2}):(?P<seconds>\d{2}) (?P<year>\d{4})')
month = {'Jan' : 1, 'Feb' : 2, 'Mar' : 3, 'Apr' : 4, 'May' : 5, 'Jun' : 6, 'Jul' : 7, 'Aug' : 8, 'Sep' : 9, 'Oct' : 10, 'Nov' : 11, 'Dec' : 12}
date = reg.search(value).groupdict()
year = int(date.get('year')) month = month.get(date.get('month', None), None) day = int(date.get('day')) hours = int(date.get('hours')) minutes = int(date.get('minutes')) seconds = int(date.get('seconds'))
newdate = datetime(year, month, day, hours, minutes, seconds)
log['date'] = newdate

callBack.name: YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss

description.localized_desc: YYYY matches the year (2012) MM matches the number of the month (01, 02, 03 etc...) DD matches the number of the day (01, 02, 03, etc...) hh:mm:ss matches the time (23:54:42)

callBack.code:
reg = re.compile('(?P<year>\d{4})-(?P<month>\d{2})-(?P<day>\d{2}) (?P<hours>\d{2}):(?P<minutes>\d{2}):(?P<seconds>\d{2})')
date = reg.search(value).groupdict()
year= int(date.get('year')) month = int(date.get('month')) day = int(date.get('day')) hours = int(date.get('hours')) minutes = int(date.get('minutes')) seconds = int(date.get('seconds'))
newdate = datetime(year, month, day, hours, minutes, seconds)
log['date'] = newdate

callback.name: MM/DD/YY, hh:mm:ss

description.localized_desc: MM matches the number of the month (01, 02, 03 etc...) DD matches the number of the day (01, 02, 03, etc...) YY matches the year (12) hh:mm:ss matches the time (23:54:42) The year is set arbitrarily in the XXIst century.

callback.code:
reg = re.compile('(?P<month>\d{2})/(?P<day>\d{2})/(?P<year>\d{2}), (?P<hours>\d{1,2}):(?P<minutes>\d{2}):(?P<seconds>\d{2})')
date = reg.search(value)
date = date.groupdict()
year= int(date.get('year')) month = int(date.get('month')) day = int(date.get('day')) hours = int(date.get('hours')) minutes = int(date.get('minutes')) seconds = int(date.get('seconds'))
newdate = datetime(2000 + year, month, day, hours, minutes, seconds)
log['date'] = newdate

callback.name: YYMMDD hh:mm:ss

description.localized_desc: YY matches the year (12) MM matches the number of the month (01, 02, 03 etc...) DD matches the number of the day (01, 02, 03, etc...) hh:mm:ss matches the time (23:54:42)

callback.code:
reg = re.compile('(?P<year>[0-9]{2})(?P<month>[0-9]{2})(?P<day>[0-9]{2}) (?P<hours>(?:[0-9]{2}| [0-9])):(?P<minutes>[0-9]{2}):(?P<seconds>[0-9]{2})')
date = reg.search(value) date = date.groupdict()
year= int(date.get('year')) month = int(date.get('month')) day = int(date.get('day')) hours = int(date.get('hours')) minutes = int(date.get('minutes')) seconds = int(date.get('seconds'))
newdate = datetime(2000 + year, month, day, hours, minutes, seconds)
log["date"] = newdate

callback.name: ISO8601

description.localized_desc: Converts a combined date and time in UTC expressed according to the ISO 8601 standard. Also commonly referred to as "Zulu Time". Precision can be up to the millisecond.

callback.code: r = re.compile(""" (?P<year>\d{4})- (?P<month>\d{2})- (?P<day>\d{2}) T(?P<hour>\d{2}): (?P<minute>\d{2}): (?:(?P<second>\d{2}) (?:\.(?P<microsecond>\d{3}))?)?Z""", re.VERBOSE) m = r.match(value).groupdict() m = dict( [ (u, v and int(v) or 0) for u,v in m.items() ] ) m['microsecond'] = m['microsecond'] * 1000 log['date'] = datetime(**m)

callback.name: EPOCH

description.localized_desc: Converts an EPOCH timestamp to a human-readable date.

callback.code: log['date'] = datetime.utcfromtimestamp(float(value)) # specific to project WLB if '_timezone' in log.keys(): log['_timezone'] = 'UTC'

callback.name: dd-MMM-YYYY hh:mm:ss

description.localized_desc: Converts a date as in 28-Feb-2010 23:15:54 . This format is used in BIND9 logs among others. Precision can be up to the millisecond.

callback.code: MONTHS = ['Jan', 'Feb', 'Mar', 'Apr', 'May', 'Jun', 'Jul', 'Aug', 'Sep', 'Oct', 'Nov', 'Dec'] r = re.compile('(?P<day>\d+)-(?P<month>\w+)-(?P<year>\d{4}) (?P<hour>\d+):(?P<minute>\d+):(?P<second>\d+)(?:\.(?P<microsecond>\d+))?') m = r.match(value).groupdict() m['month'] = MONTHS.index(m['month']) + 1 m = dict( [ (u, v and int(v) or 0) for u,v in m.items() ] ) m['microsecond'] = m['microsecond'] * 1000 log['date'] = datetime(**m)
